intro: Bidens awaluana, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small yellow flowers with prominent white ray florets, often arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Bidens awaluana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and roadsides.
